then rinsing it with water', he said. Sources also reported seeing used Hellman's mayo jars in the trash cans behind the house. According to national tune experts, the water-oil is causing major breakthrough in volume that produce tuna.

The 'tuna boy', as he is now known, commented: 'it's about my runs, wait till you taste my fantastic 'Wonder Slav' cole slaw, and my soon-to-be famous Giuliano Milk Shake'.

Freak Show
By Charles Shushkin
Coney Island Manifesto

It's that time of the year when the Coney Island freak show comes back to town. This year, the show will feature some of the Bear's favorites: Dicky the Penguin Man.... Watch Dicky as he apparently shuffles cards with two stumps. The Tattooed Lady... 'Look!!! All mean and no centerfold' and to your own amazement, if I may say, muscles, you got moving pictures!!!
Shows are every hour, on the hour. No photos.

Fans wild over Dynamite Tuna
By Chaim Gitler
Mermaid Ave. Quarterly

Every so often, a genius comes along with a new recipe that takes the world by storm. The recipe this time?... the son of a Coney Island fireman, who worked for months honing the magic recipe for the perfect tuna salad. The entire neighborhood waits on line for hours outside the fireman's house, for just one small taste of the 'miracle tuna'. Folks can't believe that the young lad had the wisdom or knowledge to create such a masterpiece in tuna.

When asked for the recipe, the teen will only reveal one part of the secret 'It has to do with squeezing the oil out of the tuna,

Teen brings home Brit
By Morton Beecher
I.N.A. Roscoe Sheet

A cocky Coney Island teenager met a genuine British Pachoochie and had the audacity to bring her home to live in his parent's house. His mother never trusted the pachoochie and believed that she insidiously sapped the intelligence and manhood from her son. After months of monitoring and evesdropping however, tuna, the mother supplied the I.N.S. with all the dope on this wild deported and had her deported. When the boy regained his senses, he and his totally forgotten any details of the British pachoochie.

insights: Freak show article references Coney Island carnival history
Dicky the Penguin Man shuffles cards with stumps - dark humor
Tattooed Lady with moving picture tattoos - fantasy element
Dynamite Tuna recipe as neighborhood sensation
Son of Coney Island fireman as tuna salad genius
Secret involves squeezing oil from tuna and water rinse
Hellman's mayo jars in trash as evidence
Wonder Slav cole slaw and Giuliano Milk Shake references
British Pachoochie story - xenophobic mother narrative
Mother reports to I.N.S. leading to deportation
Boy forgets British girlfriend after deportation
Pachoochie as derogatory term for foreign woman
Multiple references to local Coney Island culture
Continuation of tuna story from earlier content
